entry.title: Ego Death Capital Raises Over $43 Million To Fund Bitcoin Companies
entry.summary: Ego Death Capital, a venture capital fund focused on investing in Bitcoin technology startups, has announced the successful first close of its $100 million second fund. The fund has already secured $43.35 million in commitments from investors, underscoring strong interest in backing the next wave of Bitcoin companies. Ego Death has previously backed leading startups like Relai, Breez, Fedi, LN Markets, and more. Founded by Jeff Booth, Andi Pitt, and Nico Lechuga, Ego Death Capital targets Series A investments in rapidly scaling Bitcoin startups with this fund. Preston Pysh and Lyn Alden have also recently joined them as a General Partner in the second fund. The successful first close demonstrates the surging appetite among investors to allocate capital to the expanding Bitcoin technology sector. According to Ego Death founding partner Nico Lechuga, "While there are a number of Bitcoin-only VC funds investing at the Seed stage, there was no Series A-focused fund to support the rapidly developing ecosystem." Jeff Booth commented, "There are almost no words to describe the feeling of having a front seat in the creation of value on a protocol that brings truth, hope, and abundance to 8 billion people." The ability of prominent venture funds to raise sizable funds focused purely on Bitcoin startups signals the maturity and growth of the broader ecosystem. More access to late-stage capital will accelerate the development and usage of Bitcoin technology.

Ripple Lauds Filedgr

entry.title: 3rd Largest Bitcoin Miner on Wall Street Acquires Crypto Competitor for $93 Million
entry.summary: Riot Platforms (NASDAQ: RIOT), the third largest Bitcoin mining company by market capitalization, announced this week its acquisition of Kentucky-based Block Mining for $92.5 million. The deal immediately boosts Riot's hash rate and expands its geographical footprint beyond Texas into new energy markets. Riot Platforms Acquires Block Mining for $92.5 Million, Expands Bitcoin Capacity The transaction, which closed on July 23, involves an $18.5 million cash payment and $74 million in Riot common stock. An additional earn-out of up to $32.5 million is possible through 2025, contingent on Block Mining securing additional power purchase agreements. Block Mining operates two sites in Kentucky with a combined 60 megawatts (MW) of operational capacity, which Riot plans to e…

entry.title: Gemini Co-Founder’s Criticism Of Harris’ Crypto Stance Fuels Demands For Major Policy Shift
entry.summary:
The anticipated 2024 November elections in the US have stirred discussions within the crypto community regarding the potential stance of Vice President Kamala Harris towards the industry, should she become the Democratic Party’s nominee.
With uncertainty shrouding her position, voices from the crypto space have raised concerns about her willingness to support the crypto sector in the event of assuming the presidency.
Political Rift In Crypto
Tyler Winklevoss, co-founder of crypto exchange Gemini, took to social media to issue a pointed critique, claiming that immediate actions such as removing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gensler, halting enforcement actions, and ending Operation Chokepoint 2.0, as imperative steps for Harris to take in order to earn the support…

entry.title: FCA Penalizes CBPL £3.5 Million for Violating High-Risk Customer Restrictions
entry.summary: CB Payments Limited (CBPL) has been fined £3,503,546 by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) for breaching a regulatory requirement. The fine is a result of CBPL's failure to comply with a rule that prevented it from offering services to high-risk customers. CBPL, part of the Coinbase Group, operates a global cryptoasset trading platform. While CBPL itself does not handle cryptoasset transactions, it facilitates customer access to these transactions through other Coinbase Group entities. The firm is not registered for cryptoasset activities in the UK. CBPL Breaches High-Risk Limits In October 2020, CBPL agreed to a voluntary requirement (VREQ) after discussions with the FCA. This requirement was imposed due to concerns about the effectiveness of CBPL’s financial crime co…

entry.title: Bitstamp Next: Final Batch of Mt. Gox Payouts To Commence—Here’s When
entry.summary:
Following Kraken exchange’s recent distribution, Mt. Gox creditors have now been slated to receive the final batch of their long-awaited funds.
Earlier today, Bitstamp, a renowned digital currency exchange, announced it will distribute the next batch of Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Ethereum to affected parties.
The Payout Process Continues
Bitstamp, a platform that ranks among the oldest in the cryptocurrency exchange sphere, disclosed that it would soon initiate the disbursing of digital assets to creditors of the defunct Mt. Gox exchange.
On Wednesday, Bitstamp confirmed the receipt of significant amounts of Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, and Ethereum from the Mt. Gox trustees. The distribution to eligible Bitstamp account holders will start on Thursday, July 25.
The distribution repre…

entry.title: HSBC Australia Blocks Crypto Transactions amid $171M Loss
entry.summary: HSBC's Australian branch has informed customers that it has begun blocking payments to cryptocurrency exchanges starting July 24. The bank cited scams as the reason for this action. HSBC Blocks Crypto Payments In a July 24 email to customers, HSBC Australia explained its "new safety measures." The bank stated: "From 24 July 2024, HSBC will block payments from bank accounts and credit cards that we reasonably believe are being made to cryptocurrency exchanges, for your protection." The email also advised customers to find alternative ways to make payments to these exchanges. HSBC supported its decision by referencing data from Australia's competition and consumer regulator, which showed Australians lost up to $171 million in investment scams in 2023. The bank apologized fo…

entry.title: Bitcoin Takes Over Las Vegas Sphere: First Crypto To Be Displayed
entry.summary:
Bitcoin (BTC), the largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, took over the Las Vegas Sphere over the weekend. The flagship crypto was displayed on the largest LED screen in the world as part of Crypto.com’s anniversary. Despite the excitement, a discussion sparked regarding Dogwifhat’s campaign to bring the memecoin to the Sphere.
Bitcoin Takes Over The Las Vegas Strip
On Sunday night, the Las Vegas skyline was captured by the largest cryptocurrency in the world for a minute and a half after being displayed in the Sphere. The spherical venue contains the largest interior and exterior wraparound LED displays worldwide, worth $2.3 billion.
The Sphere displayed a video with a massive Bitcoin logo taking over the Las Vegas Strip before turning into rotating golden coins with the…

entry.title: What's the Meta? Meet the Solana Dev Who Suffered Third Degree Burns to Pump a Token
entry.summary:
Meet Mikol: the Dare dev that doused himself in isopropyl alcohol and had fireworks shot at him. He instantly went up in flames and was rushed to hospital, where it became apparent he suffered third degree burns.
In this episode, Mikol reflects on the biggest night of his life, details his injuries, and the grueling recovery process he’s still in. Despite the traumatic incident, Mikol isn’t done with the project. Instead, he’s planning to build a decentralized app where community members can take on dares in exchange for DARE tokens.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 156 - ETH ON THE RISE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$147m. ETH outperforms with ETF optimism. Germany government moves 2375 BTC again. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Goldman Sachs to launch 3 tokenisation projects. Realised losses similar to COVID period. Staked ETH nears ATH. CEX stablecoin volume hits 7-month low. CFTC says 70-80% of crypto not securities. Base hardfork improves compression 20-30%. BitMEX pleads guilty to AML violation. APTOS & SEI see weak attendance at ETHcc event.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 155 - ETFs SAVE THE DAY
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: $216m. $654m of inflows into ETFs over 3 days. BTC transaction fees hit 4-year low. German state moves $300m BTC, holdings $1bn. SOL flips ETH for 7d DEX volumes. SOL Firedancer sees first accepted block on testnet. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Crypto monthly active addresses tops 100m. Biden crypto veto now expected to be upheld. Tech coalition urges Biden to back crypto. People face security threats at ETHCC. DBS sees 300% growth in crypto trading. PYUSD now 7th largest stable coin. China may have already sold BTC holdings. Elliptic exposes $11bn USDT scam network. StanChart in talks to buy Howard’s crypto fund. Polychain accuses former employee of side deals. SEI leads altcoins as it launches v2 mainnet beta. TIA rises 80% from lows on short squeeze. TON to release L2 based on Polygon’s tech stack.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 154 - THE CELEBS ARE BACK...
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$295m. ETF inflows fight German selling, BTC unchanged. German government sells $900m BTC, moves more. Rate of sales implies German supply sold this week. ETH ETFs set to launch next week. Election may affect SOL ETF decision March 2025. Raydium beats ETH for 24hr fees. BTC ‘power law’ points to 300% gain by 2025. BTC in 80 day post-halving re-accumulation phase. BlackRock treasury fund hits $500m. Republicans release pro-crypto policy. Senate urges blockchain tests for national security. Drop in BTC mining difficulty ‘comparable to FTX’. MetaMask introduces delegation toolkit. 25 major projects to launch tokens in H2 2025.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 153 - A WEAK WEEKEND
entry.summary: BTC sinks 5% then bounces back to unchanged. $58-60k the main area for ‘shorts to defend’. Crypto funds saw $441m inflows last week. German government transfers 1000 BTC to sell. Crypto sentiment at lowest in over a year. ETH spot premium hits local highs. Japanese firm Metaplanet buys $2.5m BTC. Expect more miners merging: TeraWulf CEO. SOL Firedancer bug bounty goes live. GLM transfers $117m of ETH treasury to exchanges. 98% of coins have topped this cycle: Kang. ETH ETF should come in next 2 weeks: Geraci. Crypto progress disheartening: Copeland.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 152 - JOINED BY DEEZE!
entry.summary: BTC hits $54k, set for worst week in over year. Mt. Gox begins to move BTC & make distributions. German government continues to sell holdings. Worst day for BTC liquidations since FTX. Justin Sun says he is willing to buy German BTC. German MP calls on it to stop selling BTC. $52k super-trend support line eyed for BTC. Funding rates turn extremely negative across majors. Only 6 mining machines profitable below $56k. Coinbase spot buyers emerge to counter drop. Total3 hits RSI lows only hit 4 times in last 4 years. Fear & Greed index hits lowest since Jan 2023. Capo remains bullish. Real selling begins at $38k: Schiff. Coinbase continue to fight for Gensler’s emails. Circle mints $250m USDC on SOL. Symbiotic hits $1bn TVL. Taiwan Mobile may open crypto exchange. Unisat completes funding round with Binance.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 151 - BTC TAPS THE 60K LINE
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: -$14m. BTC drops to $60k, CME gap filed again. $1bn shorts liquidated if we rally to $62.6k. Pump(.)fun surpasses ETH for revenue. ETH will outperform BTC after ETF launch: K33. ETH ETF may be delayed even further. BTC heading to $150k: Fundstrat. Chainlink & Fidelity partner for fund data on-chain. USDC protects the dollar: Circle ad. Robinhood considers crypto futures in US & EU. Another BTC miner looks to IPO in US. Vitalik bullish on prediction markets. Sentient Labs raises $85m for AI on SOL. Mantra to tokenise $500m of real estate. TAO falls 15% after security breach. Crypto scams & hacks hit $572m in Q2.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 150 - BILLY TO A BILLY?
entry.summary: BTC ETF inflows hit highest in a month. ETH ETF inflows to hit $5bn in 6 months: Gemini. ETH public funds see largest outflow since 2022. SOL hits new ATH for monthly economic value. Sellers starting to look exhausted: Crypto Quant. Silvergate sued by SEC, settles for $63m. Circle gets stablecoin license for USDC in EU. US DoJ ironically chooses Coinbase for custody. Bitcoin miner aims for $16bn IPO. Bitfarms increases BTC mining amid takeover attempt. DOT has 2 year runway amid large burn. DOT ecosystem builders turn against team. PENDLE TVL falls $3bn as restaking rewards end. PayPal stablecoin goes live on Jupiter. At least $600m altcoin unlocks this month.
